author: felixweber
title: Cross Chain Cyber Security Collab
description: Los ataques de Spam & Scam son un hilo conductor enorme para todas las comunidades de DLT/Blockcain. Varias comunidades trabajan en soluciones. ¿Cómo podemos colaborar?

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is slightly different from the others in the sense that instead of providing a direct solution to the problem, it provides an indirect one. Its main idea is building an environment where collaboration could be leveraged. Having said that even if it succeeds it does not mean it will be easier for people to identify if information about Cardano is true or attacks on the network are being avoided. In other words, it does not effectively solve the initial problem of risking a disinformation attack eroding the trust of the Cardano environment and making it lose value. Its metrics make sense in the context of the idea proposed but are not really aligned with the outlined challenge settings. In sum, I believe its impact is limited.
f6_assessments.q1: Not much evidence was provided regarding the skills and experience of the team responsible for the project. Some teams that will take part were mentioned such as the bridge builders, the catalyst swarm and the ambassadors' guilds but no link was provided for background check. The proposal does not indicate how many people will be needed or which positions they will have to play. Also, the total amount of the budget is reasonable, but it does not explain how they estimated each part. Besides that, there is a fund for unexpected costs which is positive. Moreover, the timetable is realistic but a bit short, they could have explored more possible actions to expand the impact of the proposal. Finally, more thoughts could have been given regarding the risks and challenges relevant to a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: Some evidence was provided to audit the advancement of the proposal. There is a roadmap with relevant milestones and the KPIs defined are objective and will be helpful in determining if progress is according to the plan. However, instead of "number of developed cross chain misinformation attack solutions" a better KPI would be "number of developed cross chain misinformation attack proposed solution" because even if a solution is proposed but does not work it is still a measure of how the collaboration hub is going. Also, the KPIs were created but no targets were defined, so what success looks at each milestone is unclear.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal  effectively fits into the challenge brief , the problem of Spam & Scam attacks are  known issues in the blockchain ecosystem.
The solution as provided seems more of explorations or research than a concrete solution to solve the problem statement by the Team.

"How we do that" section is not clear to solve the problem statement.

The team wants to set up and maintain a cross chain community and communication Hub, which is not clear if its a physical hub , social media ,  Telegram or Discord server , is not stated.

The team also wants to raise awareness of the initiatives which are vague, awareness of Spam & Scam Attack? Or  awareness of cross chain community and communication Hub?
The team also wants to create a cross chain center of gravity , Where this point will be is unknown.
Each cross chain team on the blockchain has a proprietary  technology and some specific use cases. How will the cross chain center of gravity work?

It seem the team want to duplicate the current initiative of The Catalyst Swarm to fight Spam and Scam attack which  will be very ineffective because the community will not have to wait for a cross chain weekly  calls that focuses on: "defend against misinformation attacks" to fight an ongoing spam and scam that can occur in the middle of the night.

I suggest that the team should first explore all the possible solutions and come up with the right solution.
f6_assessments.q1:
The experience of the team is great but no prior experience in fighting  Scam on the blockchain is included , there is no profile link of the team to access.

The feasibility section of the proposal is a bit contradictory , "The Fact that the Bridge builders already explore and maintain excellent relations to other DLT/Blockchain …" suggest that the team had done the explorations already and should be able to proffer effective solutions to the problem statement.
Again no evidence is provided of the explorations done by Bridge builders.
But the proposal is focused on Exploration again. 

I like the fact that the team want to Launch a Cross Chain "defend against misinformation attacks" Conference
f6_assessments.q2:
The road map is well defined and the budget Item is clear , The KPI is not detailed enough , what will be the definition of success after 3, 6 and 12 months.

The audit-ability section is not well detailed.

f6_assessments.q0: Interesting idea. Most proposals in the challenge focus on disinformation while this proposal focuses on spreading the information across the multiple teams/applications on the Cardano ecosystem. By focusing on this you get to create a stream of information that connects the teams and this, in turn, makes it harder for disinformation to seep in.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the team, we have Cardano ambassadors, community members, Swarm team,... In short one impeccable team that does not really need an introduction but they surely provide this and give no reason to doubt they are not capable of delivering success. As we know Catalyst project is about testing and discovering new solutions to problems and this proposal is no different. It's about discovering what a cross-chain environment is capable of in terms of communication.
f6_assessments.q2: As stated in the proposal everything is trackable in GitHub. For the proposal itself, we see a clear roadmap en breakdown of the funding request. One thing that could've been a bit more clearer is the budget breakdown by providing a bit more in-depth information on this. The amount of team members for each task for example.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal comes up with a great and efficient idea related to the challenge. We are not facing the problems alone and collaboration and info sharing with other communities make a lot of sense. The problem in relation to the challenge is well thought and explained. The proposal well details how the collaboration will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. The goals and the solution are well aligned to the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal lead is a highly active and respected member of the community as well as the Swarm which is highly impactful in our community life. It would have been helpful to have more information thou about "The Bridge Builders" and "The Ambassadors Guilds". 
There is no doubt that there is relevant experience in meetups and hub management but would be good to have mentioned some relevance of the experience to the challenge subject - Disarm cyber disinformation attacks.
The proposal well explains the roles of the various organizations. It is not clear from the proposal how many team members will be involved and/or how the budget will be distributed within the teams/roles. 
The budget is for three months and it could have been helpful to provide an estimation of will be the required ongoing budget to maintain the activities.  
The proposal already mentioned Polkadot and IOTA as initial collaborators but it could be helpful to know which other chains could be relevant, who is the right team to connect to within each chain, and how we make sure we all or the right information is being reported and collected.   
The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work and provides good information about the process. 
It is not very clear from the proposal how the information about potential risks and threats is going to be shared with the community - swarm sessions? communication hub? Conference? 
Overall great idea, team, and plan. The key concern is regarding the budget size and having some more details about the various budget categories, how it is being distributed as well as the estimation for an ongoing cost post 3 months. I would have considered requesting a lower budget for Fund 7 to build the framework and then present a yearly operating budget.
f6_assessments.q2:
Metrics/KPIs are well defined and could be audited and evaluated. It could have been good to have some estimations and forecasts for example how many chains will join the collaboration and how many "Number of developed cross-chain misinformation attack - solutions" and elaborate more about this last KPI. 
A roadmap with milestones is well presented for the first 3 months. It will be good to understand what is plan going forward and how "The Cross Chain Security Circle" will be maintained. 
The community could track the progress of the proposals through the meetup recording/documentation and monthly reports so there will be full transparency of the activities.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer gives a clear description of the issue in the problem statement but does not give a single solution, which is something that the proposer states itself. The "solution" is more of an early stage to find solutions against the misinformation attacks. Nevertheless, building a hub to bring together members across all networks suffering from these kind of attacks so that they can build solutions together, is still an important task to accomplish. I think that it will indeed have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Although there will be a lot of members in order to build and coordinate this hub, the proposer does not give account of what experience will be necessary to deliver on the proposal. There aren't any links or references of relevant experience and it is not clear who the members of the team are. When referring to the "Bridge builders" between the different DLT/Blockchain communities already exploring and maintaining excellent relations to other DLT/Blockchains, the proposer should give some information and evidence on how they actually do that or/and which blockchains these are. There is also no sign of indicating some awareness of the risks to the project or how the team members will cope with them. The budget has been broken down into items, but it is not clear how the team members are going to be rewarded.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and milestones, including time horizon, are well described. The given metrics measure what the proposer wants to do and the success of his actions is indeed defined (participants in the calls, solutions to be developed, established team members), but it would be more clear, would the proposer state some numbers of those metrics, for example how many participants does it take to think of the proposal as a success? The proposer also states that all actions will be documented via Github for the community members to track the progress of the idea (it would be useful to cite the Github link at this point), and that there will also be a monthly report via the Catalyst Town Hall.

f6_assessments.q0:
It is my understanding this proposal seeks to conduct collaborative conversations and setup a collab hub for cross chain talks on the disinformation issue. Anticipated impact for the cardano ecosystem will be diluted with human nature being focuse on the project of home community. They could lead to dilution if the members representing Cardano community are not willing to accept expert input from subject matter experts on identified solutions. A quick web search returned a existing protocol project conducting a similar concept. https://www.absolem.network/ 
I feel the proposal team could have included more information regarding methodology or research discussed internally within the Cardano community/proposal team.
f6_assessments.q1: The timeline and budget is outlined for the execution of the proposal, It could be more detailed for the 11kUSD amount requested. Given the amount requested and rewards structure being part of the outlay, more details is especially needed to the structure, platform and rewards mechanisms in order to understand and consider the sustainability of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: With no identified single solution, measurable metrics for success will be difficult for this proposal. It feels like a large financial request to have a conversations around the problem to maybe develop ideas for solutions. I would have like to seen in the proposal something like Through conversation refine build spec for 10 usable solutions to common disinformation attack vectors cross chain. Put forward a minimum of 5 refined solutions as proposals in future catalyst funding rounds. The Absolem project has identified "evaluation, publication, aggregation, curation, ranking" as a methodology, this is what we are doing here is project catalyst through idea scale.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is a nice idea. The problem to solve is clearly described, but as the proposal itself states, it does not offer a single and concise solution to the problem. The idea is to establish active and regular communication between DLT/Blockchain communities about how to mitigate misinformation campaigns with the goal to share experiences and knowledge and ultimately arrive together to new solutions to the misinformation problem.

This idea can have great impact on the Cardano ecosystem and community (and also on other communities, which is great)! However, the fact that this proposal aims to create mostly the stage for communication  and leave the solution creation to community members could take away from the final impact. I believe that the proposers should aim not only to bring people together but also help them arrive to solutions or reach out to even more people that would like to implement their ideas. Ideally, in the end we would like a number of concrete solutions to come out of this.

Of course, concrete solutions as a final outcome would require more time and effort, but would make the idea more impactful and worthwhile.
f6_assessments.q1:
Even though the proposal seems quite feasible at first sight, my opinion is that it lacks a few things.

The proposers state that they are experienced members of the Cardano community with great connections to other DLT/Blockchain communities, but do not provide enough information to back up these claims (outside from their Catalyst profiles). The number of people that will be involved is not clearly stated (4 proposers), which is also true about the task division and how many people will be needed for each task.

The budget is outlined relatively clearly, but more information would be welcome, such as number of people and time devoted to each task. "Treasury for unexpected costs" is also defined without explaining what these extra costs might be.

The implementation plan is there but more information would help. It is not clear if the first phase of the project and especially the biweekly calls will be held for January only, or if they will continue for more. Also, the first phase seems the most demanding for the project team and without more information it is not clear if it can be achieved fully. Regarding the second phase, the role of the proposers is not clearly stated, i.e., how involved they will be in the team formation and guidance. The third phase is about launching a "defend against misinformation attacks" conference, but no more information is provided.

I believe that with a more concise plan and a backup plan in case things do not go as planned, e.g., there is not enough interest from the community, this proposal would be much more complete.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal defines a roadmap and has a clear timeline of ~3 months. The metrics/KPIs are presented and make sense. However, what I miss is an estimate of success, i.e., how many call participants would make a call successful, or how many final solutions would make this whole endeavor successful. The team behind the proposal will use GitHub for reporting and tracking of progress and also participate in the Catalyst Town Hall which will add greatly to the auditability and visibility of the project.

solution: Explorar un entorno de cadena cruzada en el que las comunidades de DLT/Blockchain compartan experiencias comunes y empiecen a construir soluciones juntas.
